meanings.definition: The quality or state of being undulant.
meanings.sent1: The undulance of the ocean waves was mesmerizing to watch.
meanings.sent2: The undulance of the hills in the distance created a peaceful landscape.
meanings.sent3: The undulance of the dance floor made it seem like the room was alive.
meanings.sent4: The undulance of the music filled the room with a sense of movement.
meanings.sent5: The undulance of the fabric gave the dress a flowing and elegant look.

meanings.sent1: The undulance of the snake's body as it slithered across the ground was fascinating.
meanings.sent2: The undulance of the flag in the wind caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent3: The undulance of the roller coaster made everyone scream with excitement.
meanings.sent4: The undulance of the road ahead seemed to stretch on endlessly.
meanings.sent5: The undulance of the river's current carried the boat downstream smoothly.

meanings.definition: The property of having a wavelike form or motion.
meanings.sent1: The undulance of the field of wheat swaying in the breeze was a beautiful sight.
meanings.sent2: The undulance of the sound waves filled the room with music.
meanings.sent3: The undulance of the crowd's cheers echoed through the stadium.
meanings.sent4: The undulance of the heat waves distorted the view of the desert landscape.
meanings.sent5: The undulance of the flag's fabric in the wind symbolized freedom and movement.
